description: 1988 35th Anniversary Coupe Bloomington Gold Certified, Bloomington Survivor Gold and Bloomington Gold Benchmark!!! EXTRAORDINARY and STUNNING!!!  Only 1100 miles!!!  Car just returned from Bloomington so no miles since being judged! This car is about as perfect as one can find! 35th Anniversary cars have always been somewhat special and sought after, but finding one like this is just that much more special! Having achieved the above awards not only validates originality but also confirms the outstanding condition of nearly everything as well. 5.7 Liter 350 CI 240HP Engine with 4 Speed Automatic Transmission with Overdrive. All standard Corvette equipment plus

Dual Roof Package consisting of Black Removable Roof Panel and Blue Transparent Top that is still covered in it's white protective film. 35th Anniversary Package, Six Way Power Drivers and Passenger Seats, White Leather Sport Adjustable Seats with Marching White Steering Wheel, Z52 Sport Handling Package, Color - Coordinated White Wheels, Electronic Air Conditioning, Delco Gold Bose Stereo System. This is car number 1573 of only 2050 produced. If you wanted one when they came out, but were not fortunate enough to get one, well here is your chance to get one that is nearly new. WOW!!!.

Corvette fans couldn't be happier in 1986 when, in honor of the 75th anniversary of the Chevrolet Motor Division, the all-new C4 Corvette convertible was chosen to be the official pace car of the famed Indianapolis 500 race. Only 732 yellow Corvette convertibles were sold in 1986 but what makes this drop-top stand apart is that it is one of the five actual pace cars involved with the race at the famed Brickyard. Serving as a backup track car this Corvette was used in festivals and special events surrounding the big race. Accompanying the Corvette is a treasure trove of factory and race-day documentation that include items like the original window sticker, a Chevrolet poster signed by all 33 Indy 500 drivers, a commemorative Indy 500 license plate (75) signed by race winner Bobby Rahal as well as a newspaper picture of pace car driver General Chuck Yeager in this actual car! This all-original Corvette also received the most prestigious award available from worldwide-recognized Bloomington Gold Corvettes by adorning the convertible with its Gold Certified Certificate. This special Corvette even spent time on display at the Corvette Museum in Bowling Green, Kentucky! Over the years pace cars have typically been modified for on-track duties, but the Corvette's track-ready suspension and available 350 CI/230 HP fuel injected small block made upgrades unnecessary. Nonetheless, rather than being just a track car, it is exceptionally well-equipped with power leather bucket seats, digital instrumentation, air conditioning, cruise control, power windows and AM/FM stereo to name a few. Complete with a custom dash plaque and the original graphics this historically significant 1986 Corvette convertible pace car has been driven a mere 12K miles since new and is presented in exceptional physical and mechanical condition. Power is courtesy of the aluminum cylinder head L98 5.7-liter V8 that produces 230 horsepower and is mated to a 4-speed overdrive transmission. The Corvette rolls on its original P255/VR5016 Goodyear tires (Hendrick Performance will offer a new set of comparable replacement tires if desired by the new owner) mounted to the bright brushed finish aluminum wheels. Given the historical significance, great condition and the high level of documentation, this Corvette is sure to be the centerpiece of any collection for years to come! Stock Number: CCMM86 VIN: 1G1YY6789G5900055 Miles: 12,821 miles showing on the odometer (this vehicle will be sold as mileage EXEMPT) Engine: 5.7 Liter Tuned-Port Injection L98 V8 with 230 Horsepower Transmission: 4-Speed Automatic Overdrive Equipment: Aluminum Cylinder Heads, Rack and Pinion Power Steering, Independent Front and Rear Suspension, Fiberglass Monoleaf Springs, Front and Rear Stabilizer Bars, Four-Wheel Disc Anti-Lock Brakes, Limited Slip Rear Axle, Performance Axle Ratio, Electric Engine Cooling System, Radiator Cooling Boost Fan, Engine Oil Cooler, Digital Driver Information System and Dashboard Gauges, Graphite Leather Six-Way Power Bucket Seats, Air Conditioning, Power Windows, Power Door Locks, Dual Electric Sport Mirrors, Electronic Speed Control, Intermittent Windshield Wipers, Tilt-Telescopic Steering Wheel, Leather Wrapped Steering Wheel, Automatic Cornering Lights, Tinted Glass, Carpeted Floor Mats, Locking Storage Compartments, Halogen Fog and Headlamps, Dual Underhood Lights, VATS Anti-Theft System, Electronically Tuned AM/FM Cassette Stereo, Power Antenna, Black Convertible Top Items Included with the Car: Two Sets Of Keys, Original Owner's Manual, Original Window Sticker, Build Sheet, Vehicle Invoice, Bloomington Gold Certified Certificate, 1986 Corvette Brochure, Framed Chevrolet Poster Signed By All 33 Indy 500 Drivers, Commemorative Indy 500 License Plate Signed By Race Winner Bobby Rahal, Newspaper Picture Of General Chuck Yeager In This Car, Indy 500 Race Day Credentials, 1986 Corvette Specifications Booklet Warranty: This vehicle is being sold AS-IS To learn more about condition codes, the term numbers matching, conditions of sale, and Hendrick Performance, please see the bottom of this page for details and clarification. - Contact Sales Team at 704-453-2140 or

If you are a Camaro fan and you love Z28s then you have got to like these 3rd generation IROCs. Its great appearance and small production run of only 3761 convertible units converted by ASC in 1988 is what makes these collectible and desirable. Here we have an unrestored example with just at 32K original miles.  It comes with clean CarFax that supports actual mileage. The options include: original code-F Tuned-Port fuel injected 305/195hp V8 engine, 700R4 automatic overdrive transmission, 3:23 posi-trac rear axle, performance handling package with power 4-wheel disc brakes, power steering, power windows, power locks, power driver seat, tilt steering wheel, cruise control, delay wipers, ERS AM-FM stereo with power antenna and air conditioning. These cars are just now beginning to appreciate in value, so if you are looking for an affordable collector car that you can enjoy and add to your collection, take a look. For more information go to www.classiccarsinc.com under cars for sale.

There is a group of you – and you know who you are – who look beyond the late 60s and 1970 Detroit muscle – and find the 1980s era vehicles as the last true American Muscle cars.  This 1987 IROC-Z represents the ultimate 1980s American automotive time capsule.

Starting with the original window sticker, this Z28 is all stock, sans aftermarket wheels, and lowering springs. This third generation Camaro is often relegated to the bench as its older siblings take the spotlight. A departure from the traditional F-body staple, the ''third gen'' brought design modernity to Chevy's entry level performance model. Still under the original owner's care, this Z has been driven sparingly and features one of the best combos ever to grace a third gen - V8, 5-spd, T-tops, bright red paint and a leather interior.

1985 saw the introduction of the Camaro IROC-Z, an acronym for International Race of Champions Z28. The IROC-Z platform featured an upgraded suspension, larger diameter sway bars, Delco-Bilstein shocks, and the ''wonder bar,'' essentially a strut tower brace for the bottom of the car. The Z28 also featured a more aggressive front fascia, a ground-hugging front air dam, and body color ground-effects skirts with ''IROC-Z'' badging and striping.

This Camaro features the LB9 305ci V8 paired to a 5-speed manual transmission. The 305ci V8 featured hydraulic roller lifters, updated cylinder heads, and revised valve cover design. Enjoying a red on red finish that would make even the quarterback jealous, this Z28 features a unique two-tone brown leather over camel interior. All interior amenities including power windows, mirrors, door locks, and rear hatch release are original and function beautifully. The factory heater and air-conditioning will keep you comfortable in four seasons, complemented by both front and rear window defroster.
With only 32,968 miles, this pony car has remarkably seen only one owner since it left the factory. If you are of a mind for 1980s Chevy muscle, this beauty is ready for you.

The convertible Corvette returned mid year in 1986 after being absent from the lineup since 1975. The new ''C4'' convertible was selected to pace the 70th running of the Indianapolis 500. Convertible production totaled 7,315 units and each was recognized as an Indy Pace Car edition which came with the Pace Car decal package for dealer or customer installation. All 1986 convertibles also received the new aluminum cylinder heads which provided weight savings in addition to a slight bump in horsepower. The actual pace car and festival cars used at the track on race day were yellow with graphite leather interior. The pace car was driven by Chuck Yeager in 1986 and the race winner was Bobby Rahal. The car offered here is 1 of only 732 yellow cars, it's all original including the Goodyear VR50 ''Gatorback'' tires and has just 5,000 miles since new! It's the right color, it has the optional graphite leather sport seats and the rare 4+3 manual transmission. This is an investment quality example. Asking $25,000 obo. Please call Tom or Dave at (407) 428-0116 for details. Shown by appointment. Orlando Classic Cars is located 10 minutes from the Orlando International Airport (MCO).

Loaded, vintage, and very dark, this 1986 Chevrolet C10 Silverado remains highly original from its V8 to the A/C interior.  So if you want a classic truck without giving up creature comforts, read on...

This Silverado makes a terrific first impression with its black and chrome.  After all, the factory-correct color is actually called Midnight Black, and it has the kind of gloss that looks great in the moonlight.  Plus, the full Silverado premium trim package is intact.  So it includes full-length trim, shiny chrome bumpers, hood ornament, bright tailgate insert, and iconic Rally wheels.  But there's also a lot of function in this form.  For example, the added bed rails make it easier to tie things down (and the bed liner means you won't be afraid to do real truck work.)  The rear step bumper has a trailer ball insert so if your considering getting a small, vintage camper, this classic truck can add some extra flair!

Silverados were the top of the line, and this interior is an instant reminder.  A comfy cloth bench seats with textured inserts, full carpeting, power windows, power locks, cruise control, and an AM/FM/cassette stereo all look original.  And because they're all working nicely, this classic gives you the comfort of a modern pickup.  But that sliding rear window provides an old-school breeze like no new truck can.  Since the factory air conditioning is still blowing cold, feel free to open it up any time of year.

Under the hood is Chevy's reliable 305 cubic-inch small block.  This is believed to be the original V8 to the truck, and it certainly looks the part with all the right components in place and looking tidy.  It fires up nicely, and the four-barrel carburetor makes job-ready power.  Plus, you might have noticed the dual fuel tanks – another great option for those who love useful classics.  Add in power steering, power brakes, and the three-speed automatic transmission, and this Silverado is a great all-around cruiser.
Affordable, useful, and eye-catching, this is a terrific vintage truck offered for a terrific price.  Don't let it slip away. Call now!

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this beautiful 1987 Chevrolet R10 Silverado for your consideration.  This Built Workhouse has style to boot! Loaded with extras this truck is ready to rule the road! Just because your truck is built to be a workhorse doesn't mean you can't have style as well. This custom Chevy is a great finished product of some awesome modifications for style and performance. Climb on up and let's go!

It is powered by a Vortec 5.3L v8 with headers and dual exhaust.  The truck runs and handles very well.  The automatic transmission was rebuilt 2 months ago, with a receipt of $2,393.61.  Highlights include power brakes, power steering, Forever Sharp steering wheel, power windows, power locks, Sunpro temp gauge, dual gas tanks, 2 tone cloth interior, 20 inch Foose wheels, front and rear disc brakes, fiberglass tonneau cover, trailer hitch and more.  The black paint and chrome show very well.  This truck is sure to please!
To see over 80 photos of this car, including undercarriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com

1986 Chevrolet Blazer

The Chevy K5 Blazer was introduced with the 1969 model year and was based largely on the C/K pickup chassis of the day. It spanned a domestic manufacturing life of about 25 years. The last year of production for the United States was marked by the '94 model, although export models continued for about seven more years.

The Blazer was a staple full-size SUV, initially built with capable straight axles, V8 engine options, and room to take an entire family into the backcountry camping or exploring. Many were kept in stock form, but the chassis and drivetrain leant themselves readily to modifications for more serious dirt use. The full-size Blazer remains an off-road classic today.

If you are looking for a totally rust free 80's Chevy Blazer, you have found it.  Originally delivered to Con Paulos Chevrolet of Jerome, Idaho this survivor is as nice an original Blazer as you fill find. Always a western car until purchased by current owner, this Blazer is loaded with options.

Painted in bright red with white top and like new burgundy cloth interior, the only blemish is a crack in the dash. This Blazer is optioned with cruise control, power windows, power door locks, tilt wheel, air conditioning, 4-speed automatic transmission, towing package, steel wheels with chrome trim rings, 3.73 rear, 5.0-liter V8, folding rear seat and an AM/FM radio.  The paint is mostly original, and the chrome is excellent.  Included are protect-o-plates and original delivery documents.  A true survivor with just 69,250 miles, this K5 needs absolutely nothing but to be driven and enjoyed.

The Suburban is a phenomenal multipurpose vehicle well known for its extreme ruggedness and outstanding capabilities of carrying passengers and cargo. A true survivor, this unrestored 1988 Suburban shows a little over 40K miles on the odometer and has most certainly been pampered throughout its life and it shows. Believed to be garage-kept through its ownership, the paint looks terrific and all the glass is in great condition. On the cavernous interior is mint condition cloth upholstery with a bench front seat and a 60/40 split rear. This two-wheel-drive Suburban is powered by the proven Chevrolet 5.7 liter 350 cubic-inch V8 engine producing 195 horsepower and 300-foot pounds torque. It is equipped with a 4-speed automatic-over-drive transmission, air conditioning, AM/FM stereo cassette and factory aluminum wheels with Goodyear Wrangler tires to name a few. Faithfully serviced from new the Suburban needed very little when it was inspected by our Hendrick Performance technicians. An engine oil and filter change, preventative brake system flush along with the installation of a new muffler and tail pipe were just recently performed. Included with this incredible survivor SUV are the original owner's manuals as well as several service receipts. Don't miss your chance to own a fantastic Suburban in tremendous original condition!
